subtitle: Healthy mom, healthy baby
title: 5 ways to stay healthy
content:
Created by BabyCenter


1.	**Eat well**. Try to eat some fruits and vegetables every day. Eat potatoes, beans and eggs, regularly. Add nuts and seeds to your food to make it even healthier.  All fruits are good. Get lots of them. Try to have 1 extra handful of food with every meal. Do not go without food or water for too long. Carry some food, like fruit or some nuts, with you if you have to go somewhere.

2.	**Get checkups while you are pregnant**. Try to have at least 5 visits to your healthcare provider. Get your blood and urine tests and blood pressure checks done regularly. These tests help to find problems early. Then you can get treatment and keep yourself and your baby safe. 

3.	**Get tested for HIV if you are worried**. If you are HIV+, there are medicines to help keep you well and prevent your baby from being born HIV+. If you find out you are not HIV+, you can make sure you and your baby stay that way.

4.	**Take your pregnancy vitamins**. These vitamins help your baby grow well. 

5.	**Keep clean.** Wash your hands with soap before cooking and eating and after going to the bathroom. 


[How to stay fit and healthy during pregnancy][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/2_how-to-stay-fit-and-healthy-during-pregnancy_10408341.bc
